fields.summary: Oracle error: SQLState(null) vendor code(17133)

fields.description:
We recently purchased Confluence and our Installation is not big. The memory usage of Confluence grows continuously until max Memory is reached. Then Confluence gets slow and finally you get weird errors. After a restart it works fine again. But Confluence is only up for 1 or 2 days -> same behaviour...
So we increased max mem to 512MB which is quite a lot. This results in longer uptime but not much longer(still reaches maximum).

Only indication of errors in the logs are 
- backup problems see CONF-2624 (not fixed for 1.4DRx yet).Applied the fix -> now works
- JiraJdbcProfileProvider CONF-2656 and applied fix from 1.3.x release

But it doesnt improve the situation . Are there any known problems fitting our case?

Would you recommend:
-switching to 1.3.x ?
-switching from Standalone to JBOSS (for example our Jira Installation on JBOSS has a constant memory usage
 of about 80MB with long uptime...)

Most of our user use TimTam, perhaps it has something to do with it?

Cheers,

Philip
fields.summary: Growing Memory Usage leads to Errors

fields.description: This makes it very hard to diagnose database problems - we don't know if the system is configured correctly.
fields.summary: Database Dialect always shows up as N/A in system dump

fields.description:
Due to the CSS changes in the v2Renderer, the note macros now inherit CSS table border properties - the macros should have no cell borders.

Also, the panel macro has some whitespace in the header if you give the header a background colour, and the {section} macro has borders.
fields.summary: Borders in note macro

fields.description: ContentLink is using content.getTitle() to set the link body, which breaks when the content is a type that doesn't have a title. Should use getRealTitle() instead.
fields.summary: Content link dies if target is a comment.

fields.description:
include macro is really just a sectioning capabiltiy, without the title and edit button. I use it for that but creating a header and an include
-----
h2. Section Title {{[edit|Section Title]}}
{include:Section Title}
-----

It would be nice if the include macro worked like the mediawiki (aka wikipedia) section capability.

Would need:
- macro to allow for creation of section if it does not exist.
- different rendering for display and print (don't want those edit links in the output).
- renaming of pages in macros capability
fields.summary: Add Section Capability
Attaching file with too long description should warn in client, not through server

fields.description: We have about 34 spaces, and its taking >5 seconds to load..
fields.summary: Loading "Spaces" page really slow

fields.description:
Would be really nice from an admin perspective to be able to display a little banner at the top of the page (turned on/off & editable by admin only).

When ppl do an upgrade or need to take down confl for maintenance, they can enable that popup the day before - so to give users some warning.

Something sitemesh based...
fields.summary: Announcement Banner

fields.description:
When I start with a default colour scheme, and I want to edit it, the edit page should start with the default colours.

Instead it starts with a blank colour scheme...
fields.summary: Editing colour scheme - doesnt copy default colours

fields.description:
None of the settings in the confluence.cfg.xml are backed up (or therefore restored).
Colours, welcome panel - all this stuff...

I think its an indication that these settings dont belong in this file at all - they belong in the database.
fields.summary: The backup that doesnt!

fields.description:
After restoring from backup (to the point where I am asked to create jira admin user), I shutdown and enabling the JIRA user management (osuser.xml).

However, on restart, I am still required to create an admin user...
fields.summary: Setting up requires creation of admin user... even if you are using Jira user management...

fields.description:
From Zohar:

when saving a new version of a page, please save the change magnitude (+3/-1) 
this way you can easily find major page changes.

(This issue was originally CONF-2745, but that was a sub-task of a duplicate issue so it was in danger of being lost)
fields.summary: Add a change magnitude (lines added/removed) like cvs

fields.description:
If two files are attached to a page and one exceeds the attachment size maximum, the error message refuses both uploads but only reports problems with the larger file.

Behaviour should be consistent with uploading two files, where one doesn't actually exist on the filesystem. The good file is uploaded successfully and an error is reported for the non-existent file.
fields.summary: Attach multiple files loses good files if other files exceed file size limit

fields.summary: Error viewing Next >> seach results

fields.description:
The Content Tree is greedy for resources - loading a large space (2000 or more pages) can take ten or more seconds each *consecutive* time (revisit caching?).

This is symptomatic of a larger issue - that of scaling Confluence for larger volumes of data. People are generating bigger trees and we need to begin anticipating this ourselves and ensure Confluence runs well with them.
fields.summary: Content tree is greedy for resources

fields.description:
Viewing a page within the hierarchy of a large space does not anchor on the highlighted page.

If there are many pages with a depth of 1 in the content tree then you have to scroll down and actually search for the page you wanted to view in hierarchy.

We should anchor on the selected page instead.
fields.summary: 'View page in hierarchy' does not anchor on selected page in tree view

fields.description:
CPU processing is pushed to 100% when the Confluence tries render long unbroken lines of text such as: 

TlRMTVNTUAACAAAACAAIADgAAAAFgokCub9Oy9DBXqAAAAAAAAAAALwAvABAA

Examples of places where these long lines of text may appear is in PGP/MD5 signatures or web headers.
fields.summary: PGP signatures or long unbroken text stalls Confluence

fields.summary: Exception when attaching a new version of the same file

fields.description:
Hi,

I have Jira 3.0.3 Enterprise and Confluence 1.3.2 on the same maschine.
Jira is sharing the usermanagement with confluence (setup like in the documentation).

Now I have connected the Jira user password authentification to our LDAP-Server. That works fine with Jira and Confluence. For this I edited both osusers.xml files.

Now I have got the problem, that "non"-LDAP users, which I added to Jira and gave them confluence-users permission can only login into Jira but not into Confluence.

It looks like Confluence could'nt use the local passwords Jira have saved?!

I will add the both osusers.xml files.

Perhaps you can tell me what's wrong.

Thx,
Andreas
fields.summary: LDAP and non LDAP user login at Confluence

fields.description:
Ugo Cei wrote:

I'm a big fan of tags for classifying information like it's done in del.icio.us. I was thinking it would be great if we could attach a set of tags to a Confluence page, find all pages with a given tag, see what tags have already been used before tagging a page, link to del.icio.us, Technorati and all those other "social software" sites out there that already use tags. etc. etc.

I think this is a brilliant idea for making Confluence pages / information available across more dimensions.
fields.summary: Add tags for pages, like del.icio.us and Tecnorati

fields.description:
I would like to suggest an improvement in the way PDF generation is implemented.
The current hardcoded PDF generation is not to flexible in certain ways. Also customization by the enduser needs implementation of forms at Atlassians side. Customers however will always have something to complain about.

As confluence already features XML serialization, it should be not to difficult to generate docbook (http://www.docbook.org/) compliant XML from space content.

This would on one hand add a great new feature for content export, on the other hand the confluence PDF generation could be easily adapted to be based on stylesheets.

Docbook is widely used, so even freely available stylesheets can be adapted to Atlassian company standards easily.

To summarize up, docbook support would add the following benefits:

1) standard content export format
2) customer can format his content to even the most esoteric format
3) changes to PDF export easier to implement, even without appserver restart
4) content can be imported in Textprocessing software that supports docbook (e.g. OpenOffice)

Confluence would become the total killer application if it even could import the docbook format :)
fields.summary: docbook interface

fields.description:
Pages only have an alphabetic sort order... but it would be helpful for organization if they had a meta-attribute "ordinal" that could be used as a sort key.
  
There is a different collab system we have that will remain nameless (so I can curse at it's ineffective bloated carcass with impugnity)... which doesn't have explicit order features either. So the user-land workaround is to put numbers in front of everything... 
3.0 Requirements
15.0 Research & Development
16.0 Foo
 
(don't ask me why the decimals.)
 
It's ugly. It's a mess.
 
Sometimes I just want to order my pages the way I want to order them.
 
Project Foo
Overview
Initial Research
Extened Analaysis
Proposal
Implementation
Debrief
 
Cheers,
Timo
P.S. And I really with the names were fully qualified so I didn't have to have "Project Foo" appended to each page name. See CONF-2524! <grin>
fields.summary: Ordinal meta-attribute

fields.description:
CONF-1631 and CONF-1221 deal with the merged preview and edit page.  While the idea to merge the pages is good,  the order of the display actually makes it more difficult for users that edit pages especially ones that are longer or more involved.  Here are a few problems:
1. The edit section can be many pages down from the preview.
2. The update buttons are down with the edit page and need to be found even if you are happy with the preview.
3. Often the top of the preview page looks very close to the way the actual page looks leading someone to forget that they need to do the update and therefore they lose there changes when they go to another page.

It would be better to have the edit part first since this is a fixed portion of the page (less than one page in length) followed by the preview.  It would also make the page look more like an edit page than a real page.  In addition, but the update and other buttons surrounding the edit page (like now) and also at the end of the page. 

After having worked with this for a few weeks since upgrading to 1.3.2 hoping that I would start to like it, I have come to the conclusion it is worse that the original design.
fields.summary: Edit/preview page order needs to be reversed

When pulling in mail messages, Confluence displays the "Date" as the date the message was pulled in from the POP store, or possibly the date the message was put into the POP store.  It should display the date the message was sent.

I'm using a personal space in Confluence to archive important messages; I don't always drop these messages into the confluence-accessable POP store on the day the message was sent.  In this case, Confluence shows the date I put the message into the POP store.
fields.summary: properly report date on message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2689].
  {panel}

I would like to be able to specify Jira setup(s) to Confluence settings and then be able to search from those Jira instances as well. This could be represented as a separate search type 'Issues' that the user could opt out in the search. If there we multiple Jira setups connected to Confluence then there should be an option like the 'Select space' to search in. Users could selected either all or some Jiras to search from. Additionally there could then be more configuration options for the Jira searches (Jira search options: projects, issue types etc.).

This way all information would be accessible and searchable from Confluence. It would be a lot easier to find the information that users are searching for since then there would really be just one place to search from.

See: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Integrate+Confluence+Search+to+Jira+Search

This could be done over the remote api as well JIRA:JIRA XML-RPC API Spec (http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1035) and
http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1035&focusedCommentId=43490#comment-43490
fields.summary: Integrate Confluence search to Jira search

fields.description:
In light of CONF-2358, the {blog-posts} macro still displays the header, "Recent Blog Posts".

I'd actually prefer the header disappears altogether. I can make my own heading (and fit it into my own UI better).
fields.summary: header in {blog-post} macro

fields.description:
Perhaps would be better to render vertical space between paragraphs (represented as an empty line in source wike text) as rather then as
.
seems to be rendered unreliably, see for instance Before.B * item.B1 * item.B2 after.B which is rendered as Before.B
  • item.B1
  • item.B2

After.B which in tern is rendered without any vertical space between "Before.B" and "item.B1" in all of the browsers mentioned in "Environment" section of this bug report. (Note: I have erroneously entered this as a second test case into CONF-1601 which I regret bitterly -- it's a separate bug)
fields.summary: Use DIV not BR for paragraph separation
Reinstate typographic markup

fields.description: Taken out of the decorator?
fields.summary: Online help missing from global admin general config screen

fields.description:
It would be great if Confluence would also support the concept of a newsletter.
This feature would allow a specific confluence group to send an html/text email newsletter to all registered confluence users.
A bit like the daily update but the content is pushed by a specific confluence group.  Of course the confluence users could enable or disable the receival of such an newsletter (again similar to the daily update).

We could really use such a feature for our BeJUG and JavaPolis users, for which we today have to use separate software !

Thanks in advance  ;-)

Stephan
fields.summary: Wiki-related newsletter mail

fields.description:
It's sometimes hard to edit lists.  eg

# Content must fall within the parameters of the NGDA Collection Priorities.
[http://www.alexandria.ucsb.edu/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=6079]
# Content must include a non-proprietary file format that either is readily manipulated using standard image-processing or geographic-information-system software, or if a proprietary format is widely and readily used.
#* What about if their is free proprietary software, such as from ESRI, that allows one to look the files.  Should we request and archive that as well?
# Metadata must be available at the item level.
#*   What about metadata at the collections level?
#*   How complete should the metadata be for inclusion? descriptive, technical, administrative?
#*   Will we accept metadata in different ways, such as the technical information in a TIFF header, the descriptive in MARC format, and the administrative in METS format?
#*   What sort of support would the archivers provide to the content providers if they don't know much about metadata creation or standards?  Do they have to learn this to be involved?
-----------------
It might be easier if we could add no operations lines:

# Content must fall within the parameters of the NGDA Collection Priorities.
[http://www.alexandria.ucsb.edu/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=6079]
//
# Content must include a non-proprietary file format that either is readily manipulated using standard image-processing or geographic-information-system software, or if a proprietary format is widely and readily used.
#* What about if their is free proprietary software, such as from ESRI, that allows one to look the files.  Should we request and archive that as well?
//
# Metadata must be available at the item level.
#*   What about metadata at the collections level?
#*   How complete should the metadata be for inclusion? descriptive, technical, administrative?
#*   Will we accept metadata in different ways, such as the technical information in a TIFF header, the descriptive in MARC format, and the administrative in METS format?
#*   What sort of support would the archivers provide to the content providers if they don't know much about metadata creation or standards?  Do they have to learn this to be involved?

-------------
or maybe just a list macro that ignore lines:
{list}
# Content must fall within the parameters of the NGDA Collection Priorities.
[http://www.alexandria.ucsb.edu/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=6079]

# Content must include a non-proprietary file format that either is readily manipulated using standard image-processing or geographic-information-system software, or if a proprietary format is widely and readily used.
#* What about if their is free proprietary software, such as from ESRI, that allows one to look the files.  Should we request and archive that as well?

# Metadata must be available at the item level.
#*   What about metadata at the collections level?
#*   How complete should the metadata be for inclusion? descriptive, technical, administrative?
#*   Will we accept metadata in different ways, such as the technical information in a TIFF header, the descriptive in MARC format, and the administrative in METS format?
#*   What sort of support would the archivers provide to the content providers if they don't know much about metadata creation or standards?  Do they have to learn this to be involved?
{list}
fields.summary: No Op / Ignore line

fields.description: It is not possible to import the Demonstration Space again after it was exported. Seems like references to attachments get lost during the export which causes problems with the import.
fields.summary: Demo Space import fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2677].
  {panel}

Just noticed that http://confluence.atlassian.com/spaces/viewmailarchive.action?key=DOC is showing my full email address.(and other ppl's too).
Eeek!

We really want to obscure them.
And anywhere else they appear in confl...

Maybe some funky javascript email encryption ?
http://web.onetel.net.uk/~derwentdale/decode.htm
fields.summary: Obscure email addresses in Confluence Mail

fields.description:
We need to add support for personal licenses including:

 - ability to generate personal licenses (on website)
 - recognition of personal licenses (within Confluence application)
 - user management updates to disable Confluence if users are greater than 2 and instruct administrator/user to remove users so that total users = 2 or less. Plug the fact that they can purchase licenses for additional users at http://www.atlassian.com/confluence
 - update footer so that when running on personal licenses it reflects this in the footer. Include links back to http://www.atlassian.com/confluence
fields.summary: Add support for Personal Licenses (2 user)

fields.description: I'm trying to modify a space permission and I'm running into a problem when I try to add a user.  I get a "You are not allowed to remove all the Administration Permissions for this space."  I think this is a bit of a catch 22 because I was able to Administer the space before the upgrade if my name wasn't on the list, now when I try to add any user, I get an exception saying that I cannot remove the admin privilages from the space.
fields.summary: Unable to modify permissions after upgrade

fields.description:
If the export fails with an org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException, the spacePermissions can not be loaded again when they are flushed. Therefore an admin user is able to log in, but not able to access the administration section, which redirects him to the login again.

After restarting the server, the permissions are set again and everything works fine.
fields.summary: Permission are not reloaded after failing transaction

fields.description:
addGroup creates a group but converts the specified name to lowercase. However when accessing the group via userAccessor getGroup does NOT convert the specified groupname to lowercase. This means that if a remote client does addGroup("valid-token", "DUMMY-admin") the group will be created in confluence as dummy-admin. If the remote client does addUserToGroup("valid-token", "jim", "DUMMY-admin") you get a remote exception saying that the group does NOT EXIST because it is stored a dummy-admin. The problem is explained above.

Thanks.
fields.summary: addGroup converts specified groupname to lowercase and causes error while retrieving

fields.description: Had a user who spent considerable time editing a new blog entry, but unfortunately put an illegal character into the title.  When he went to preview the blog, a new page displayed an error indicating the illegal characters and advised user to return to previous page to change title.  However, on hitting Back button user gets new, blank edits page.  His content was gone.  WBNI this worked like regular pages where you simply get the red error displayed on the edits page and you are not redirected away from your edits page.

In the {panel} macro it would be nice to control the justification of the title
Using a link with an alias inside Panel macro title fails

fields.description:
If I attach an image file to a page with multi-case file name, say, "ImaGe.gif", I can type !image.gif! to a page to display it. However the exporting checks for the attachments using case-sensitive filename comparison (at least on Linux, I guess this is platform dependent) and hence doesn't pick up the images when exporting.

This might explain some of your "Images aren't exported to PDF" bug reports - Confluence is inconsistent with the file names in a manner which makes errors in the case very hard to detect. "I can see the image on the page, why doesn't it export?".
fields.summary: !image! tag is case-insensitive on page display, case-sensitive when exporting
!image! tag should allow linking to a version of an image

fields.description: When doing an export to pdf on a page which makes use of the gallery macro to display images, it works fine the first time. If you update the images, the PDF export will still pick up the old images, even though the whole image was deleted and a completely new version was added.
fields.summary: PDF Export does not pick up image updates.
